examples.translation: They went through very difficult roads.
This object is firmer than a stone.

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish پك (bek, pek), from Proto-Turkic *bek (“firm, solid, stable”).
Cognate with
Old Uyghur [script needed] (bek, “firm, solid; very”);
Bashkir бик (bik, “very”),
Kazakh бек (bek, “very, firm”),
Uyghur بەك (bek, “very”), etc.
